column1: Westport is a city in Grays Harbor County
column3: United States. The city's population was 2
column4: 099 at the 2010 census. It is located on a peninsula on the south side of the entrance to Grays Harbor from the Pacific Ocean.

column1: The public Westport Marina is the largest marina on the outer coast of the United States's Pacific Northwest. The marina is home to a large commercial fishing fleet and several recreational charter fishing vessels. A summer-only passenger ferry
column3: previously connected the town to Ocean Shores
column4: across the mouth of the harbor to the north.

column1: Westport was officially incorporated on June 26
column2: 1914.  Names for the area in the past include Peterson's Point
column4: and Fort Chehalis.  The latter name is for a U.S. Army fort established in 1860 before the town was founded
column5: "ts-a-lis" is the Lower Chehalis word for Westport
column6: meaning "place of sand". Early explorers pronounced the word "Chehalis" and gave this name to the river and the people living up river who later became the Chehalis people or "People of the Sands". The area was used regularly during the summer by local Native American tribes (most likely the Shoalwater Bay Tribe
column7: comprising Willapa Chinook and Lower Chehalis people) before Thomas Barker Speake and his family arrived early in the summer of 1857. Westport is also the home to a station for the US Coast Guard. In 2015
column8: the Ocosta School District became the first to build a publicly funded vertical tsunami shelter
